quotes.quote: Creepy people do the things that decent people want to do, but have decided are not a great idea.
Nothing is more frightening than a fear you cannot name.
It sounds creepy, but I always liked the idea of disappearing then becoming something new. That of course was before I disappeared.
How frightening, that one person could mean so much, so many things.
There's nothing quite as frightening as someone who knows they are right.
The really frightening thing about middle age is that you know you'll grow out of it.
The frightening thing is that, to enter hell, all one has to do is nothing.
The most frightening thing in the world is to discover the abnormal in that which is closest to us.
The truly frightening flaw in humanity is our capacity for cruelty – we all have it.
Only one thing is more frightening than speaking your truth, and that is not speaking.
It's frightening when things you love appear suddenly changed from what you have always known.
The most terrifying things in the universe came from human minds.
There is nothing more frightening than the faces of people whom one does not know but who seem to know one, and be amused by one.
The only way to avoid all frightening choices is to leave society and become a hermit, and that is a frightening choice.
It is frightening when a woman finally realizes that there is no answer to the question 'who am I' except the voice inside herself.
What a frightening thing is the human, a mass of gauges and dials and registers, and we can only read a few and those perhaps not accurately.
There is nothing frightening about an eternal dreamless sleep. Surely it is better than eternal torment in Hell and eternal boredom in Heaven.
How sad. How frightening. To be filled with so much hate that you could not even rejoice in the healing of a child...How did anyone ever come to that point?
The most terrifying fact about the universe is not that it is hostile but that it is indifferent.
One of the most frightening things, I think, is the capacity for retroactive searching, so you can go back in time and trace who someone is in contact with and where they've been.
The most terrifying thing is sometimes not what we see, but rather what we are forced to imagine.
It's terrifying to see someone inside of whom a vital spring seems to have been broken. It's particularly terrifying to see him in your mirror.
And the most terrifying question of all may be just how much horror the human mind can stand and still maintain a wakeful, staring, unrelenting sanity.
In every creepy movie ever made, the barn is the prime nesting ground for the things you don't know you're looking for and always regret finding.
The creepy thing about battle is you always feel alone.
It's a frightening world to be alone in.
There's nothing frightening in the dark if you just face it
It's frightening how much things change in seventy-one years.
Is there anything more frightening than people?
The irony is, nothing is more frightening than being frightened.
Nothing is more frightening than a monster that cares about his health, cause you know he'll be around for a while.
Frightening things happen in solitude.
There's something frightening about finding a woman who would take your heart.
It's frightening, the way life speeds up. When you're at school, time can't go fast enough.
It's frightening to wake up one morning and discover that while you were asleep you went out of style.
If you put frightening things into a picture, then they can't harm you. In fact, you end becoming quite fond of them.
How frightening it is to have reached the height of human accomplishment in art that must forever borrow from life's abundance.
The very damaging, frightening part of postpartum is the lack of perspective and the lack of priority and understanding what is really important.
Regardless of how hard, challenging, frightening, or difficult an experience may seem, everything is just as it needs to be in order for us to heal, grow, and learn.
It's frightening to think that you mark your children merely by being yourself. It seems unfair. You can't assume the responsibility for everything you do — or don't do.
It is terrifying to think of what a commodity art has become.
It's terrifying to be the lead. There's a moment of excitement, and then pure terror.
There is nothing more terrifying than the absoluteness of one who believes he's right.
Terrifying, that the loss of intimacy with one person results in the freezing over of the world, and the loss of oneself.
